thread.title: Goa Assembly elections 2017: After Congress cries foul, Supreme Court pulls up party, says ‘Invitation subject to numbers’
thread.title_full: Goa Assembly elections 2017: After Congress cries foul, Supreme Court pulls up party, says ‘Invitation subject to numbers’

author: FE Online
title: Goa Assembly elections 2017: After Congress cries foul, Supreme Court pulls up party, says ‘Invitation subject to numbers’
text:
Goa assembly elections 2017 Goa Assembly elections 2017: After Congress cries foul, Supreme Court pulls up party, says ‘Invitation subject to numbers’ Goa Assembly elections 2017: After Congress cries foul, Supreme Court pulls up party, says ‘Invitation subject to numbers’ The Supreme Court hearing on Congress' petition has begun. SC castigated the Congress party after it approached the apex court over the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) looking to form government in Goa despite not having enough MLAs in the assembly. By: FE Online | Published: March 14, 2017 11:38 AM Manohar Parrikar (PTI) 
The Supreme Court hearing on Congress ’ petition has begun. SC castigated the Congress party after it approached the apex court over the Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) looking to form government in Goa despite not having enough MLAs in the assembly. The bench is headed by CJI Khehar has reportedly said that only the numbers should determine who should rule state. While the Congress won 17 seats, BJP managed to get 13 and it then got the support of Independents and other parties and approached the Governor to form the government. The Congress was slow in approaching the Governor and the BJP in the meanwhile managed to steal a march on it. Senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi is appearing for the Congress while Harish Salve is the advocate for the BJP.
